intro: Sisymbrium irio var. kralikii, commonly known as the Kralik's sweet rocket, is a flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and alternate, pinnately lobed leaves. It blooms from late spring to early summer, producing clusters of bright yellow flowers that attract pollinators. This variety is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, showcasing its adaptability to various environments.
